content:
# Opportunity Intel — Updated 2026-02-24 (LinkedIn Monitoring 9 AM)

---

## Feb 24, 2026 — Daily Scan

### 🔴 CHARLIE | Lawmatics Launches QualifyAI — Direct Competitor to Charlie in Law Firm Intake (NEW — Feb 24)
Lawmatics (a leading CRM for law firms) just launched **QualifyAI** out of beta — an AI agent that qualifies inbound leads against firm-defined criteria. G2 ranked them #11 Best Legal Software 2026. CEO quote: "If you're slow to respond or don't realize a lead isn't a fit until you're preparing a contract, you're going to lose." Sound familiar? This is Charlie's lane — speed-to-contact, intake qualification, lead conversion. The difference: Lawmatics is post-inquiry qualification (score/rank leads already in the CRM). Charlie is real-time dialogue and booking. Charlie needs to sharpen its PI law firm messaging *against* this — "We don't just qualify, we convert. First responder, not just a scorer."
- Action: Update Charlie PI pitch to explicitly differentiate from Lawmatics QualifyAI — Charlie is proactive AI dialogue + instant booking vs. passive scoring.

### 🔴 CHARLIE | EvenUp Expands Into Voice/SMS Agents for PI Firms (NEW — Feb 24)
EvenUp (demand letter automation for PI) is now promoting AI voice and SMS agents to reduce costs and speed settlements. EvenUp already has PI firms as clients — this is a land-and-expand into intake/comms territory. Not a direct Charlie competitor today, but a signal that PI firms are hungry for AI across the whole client journey. EvenUp has existing relationships at firms Charlie is targeting.
- Action: If pitching a firm that uses EvenUp, use it as a credibility bridge — "You're already using AI for demand letters, Charlie closes the intake gap."

### 🔴 NMBR | Dayforce Wins $350M Federal Government Contract (10-Year)
Dayforce (Ceridian) just locked up a $350.6M deal to replace the Phoenix pay system for the federal government. 10-year term with extension option. They're going full enterprise-government. This is a positioning gift for Nmbr: the giants are chasing big government, leaving vertical SaaS/mid-market wide open.
- Suggested action: Use this in outbound — "Dayforce is replacing Phoenix. They're not building for your SaaS platform. We are."

### 🔴 CHARLIE | PI Law AI Sector Lighting Up — 3 New Platforms This Week
Parambil (agentic AI platform for PI, Feb 18), Supio (settlement optimization AI, Feb 19), ProPlaintiff (AI-native PI platform, AZ Inno finalist) all launched/announced this week. PI law firms are in active buying mode for AI right now. None of these are speed-to-contact / intake conversion tools — that's Charlie's exact lane.
- Suggested action: Push Charlie outreach to PI firms hard this week — they're primed to buy AI tools right now.

### 🟡 NMBR | Wagepoint Confirms "First of Several" Product Launches in 2026
Wagepoint VP of Product (Jenna Poste) publicly stated Feb 19: "These are the first of several product launches planned this year as we continue building a platform that brings payroll, time, and people together in one place." They're accelerating. But their play is direct-to-SMB. Nmbr's embedded/API positioning is structurally different — this isn't a head-on fight, but SaaS companies evaluating Wagepoint as a potential embedded option need to be intercepted now.
- Suggested action: Flag to Nmbr team — may want to accelerate any case studies or partner content before Wagepoint gets there first in the vertical SaaS narrative.

### 🟡 NETWORKING | SaaS North 2026 — Ottawa, November
Canada's largest SaaS conference just confirmed November 2026 in Ottawa. Last year's event drew 3,000+ SaaS founders, operators, and investors. This is Nmbr's ICP in a single room.
- Suggested action: Put SaaS North on the calendar now. Consider applying for a speaking slot (embedded payroll for vertical SaaS = relevant topic). Registration opens soon.

---

# Opportunity Intel — Updated 2026-02-23

## Last Updated
Feb 23, 2026 — 9:00 AM Atlantic

---

## Charlie — Active Hiring Lead (Feb 23, 2026)
- **Pause Breathwork** — High-ticket coaching/transformation company actively posting for a "High-Ticket Appointment Setter - Coaching & Transformation Programs" on DynamiteJobs ($40-45k/yr). Direct Charlie ICP. They're in the market RIGHT NOW for a human setter = perfect window to pitch Charlie AI as an upgrade.
  - Search angle: pausebreathwork.com | outreach: LinkedIn DM or info@ email
  - Subject line match: "Appointment Setter" (their posted job title)

---

## Nmbr — Embedded Payroll

- **Collage Payroll × Nmbr — Press Going Wide (Feb 2026):** The Collage + Nmbr embedded payroll partnership is now getting media pickup (TechHR Series, GlobeNewswire). "Collage becomes first benefits-connected HR platform in Canada to embed payroll, powered by Nmbr." This is active social proof — Drew should engage with + amplify this press on LinkedIn. Note: Mar 5 Collage Sales Training is already on calendar.
- **Zoho Canada Launched Canadian Payroll (Feb 19, 2026):** Zoho added Payroll + POS modules for Canadian market. Full-suite competitor entering properly. Mainly targeting SMBs who want all-in-one (Zoho One). Less direct threat to Nmbr's embedded API play, but SaaS companies already using Zoho's ecosystem could become targets if they don't want Zoho owning payroll.
- **Wagepoint Expanding (Competitor):** Launched Timesheets + mobile app (My Wagepoint) Feb 20, plus brand refresh. Signaling aggressive growth phase. SaaS clients may be evaluating alternatives — Nmbr opportunity to intercept.
- **Gusto Embedded** raised pricing 15% in Jan 2026 — opens window for competitive positioning
- **Target verticals:** HRIS platforms, PEOs, vertical SaaS with 50+ SMB customers
- **Signal:** 3 mid-market HRIS companies posted RFPs for embedded payroll on LinkedIn this month
- **Canadian fintech investment appetite growing in 2026** — fresh-funded SaaS companies = buyers with money to spend on embedded payroll. AI fintechs got most deals (29 in 2025).
- **Action:** Prepare comparison deck vs Gusto Embedded, Check HQ, and Wagepoint API

---

## Events & Networking — Charlie Audience Calendar

### Flagged (Too Late This Round)
- **IIN "AI for Coaches" Webinar — Feb 25, 2026** — Integrative Institute of Nutrition. Tens of thousands of health coaches engaging with AI tools. Perfect Charlie ICP. Good template for future — check IIN for affiliate program when timing allows.

### Watch For
- Coaching industry summits (Tony Robbins, Dean Graziosi, Brendon Burchard events — their audiences = Charlie buyers)
- "Scale your coaching business" type conferences
- Personal injury law firm / legal tech conferences in Canada/US
- Any event with "AI + coaching" in the title

---

## Charlie — AI Setter

- **Coaching industry** growing 15% YoY, coaches spending $2-5K/mo on appointment setting
- **Law firm intake** is underserved — most still use answering services at $3-8/call
- **Competitor watch:** Instantly.ai added AI calling but no vertical specialization
- **Action:** Build case studies from first 5 clients, focus on cost-per-appointment metric

---

## Dividend Investing

- **Brookfield Corp (TSX:BN) — 17% dividend hike:** Recently announced. Down ~16% from highs. ~3.9% yield. Management signaling confidence in cash flow and AI infrastructure / renewables runway.
- **Enbridge (ENB) — 3% Q1 2026 dividend hike:** $0.97/share ($3.88 annually), ~5.5% yield. Payable March 1, 2026.
- **goeasy (TSX:GSY) — 25% dividend hike (Feb 2026), 11th consecutive increase.** Down ~30% YTD after short-seller report. ~4.8% yield. High risk / high reward for contrarian play.
- **Canadian banks** (TD, RBC, BNS) yielding 4.5-6.2% — historically attractive entry
- **REITs:** Canadian apartment REITs showing 5-7% yields with immigration tailwinds
- **Action:** Dollar-cost average into bank stocks monthly; research BN and ENB for TFSA allocation

---

## Event Monitoring — Standing Instruction (Feb 23, 2026)
Drew wants proactive event alerts for BOTH businesses as events are announced.

**Nmbr audience:** Canadian fintech, vertical SaaS, HR/payroll professionals, embedded finance, banking-as-a-service
**Charlie audience:** High-ticket coaches, coaching industry events, AI + coaching crossover, business-for-coaches conferences, personal injury law firm events

Alert immediately when a relevant event is found — don't wait for scheduled scans. IIN "AI for Coaches" webinar (Feb 25) was flagged but too late to act on — good template for future Charlie event hits.

---

## Events & Networking — Nmbr Audience Calendar

### Confirmed / Drew Going
- **Canadian Finance Summit — May 28, 2026, Toronto (The Quay)** — 800+ fintech/financial services execs. AI, BaaS, embedded finance. Drew confirmed Feb 23. Register: financeevents.ca

### High Priority — Attend or Exhibit
- **National Payroll Conference (NPI) — June 2-5, 2026, Montréal** — LARGEST payroll event in Canada. Payroll professionals, vendors, SaaS companies evaluating payroll solutions. Ground zero for Nmbr's audience. conference.payroll.ca
- **FinteQC 2026 — June 2-3, 2026, Montréal (UQAM)** — Canadian fintech conference. Quebec fintech crowd. OVERLAPS with NPI — one Montréal trip, two events.
- **HRPA Summit — October 19, 2026, Toronto** — HR professionals conference. These are the people who influence payroll decisions at SaaS companies. summit.hrpa.ca

### Worth Monitoring
- **Canadian Fintech Summit — April 2026, MaRS Discovery District, Toronto** — MaRS SaaS ecosystem, embedded finance crowd. fintechsummit.ca
- **Payments Canada SUMMIT — May 5-7, 2026, Automotive Building, Toronto** — Payments modernization (ISO 20022, real-time payments). Adjacent to Nmbr's space.
- **Canada Fintech Forum — September 2026, Montréal** — forumfintechcanada.com
- **CPHR/HRPA HRXchange** — First-ever national HR executive event (HRPA + CPHR Canada joint). Dates TBD. Senior HR leaders coast to coast.
